concept.title: Authentication for administrators
concept.shortdesc: Two types of Couchbase administrators can authenticate with Couchbase Server using their passwords: one full administrator and one read-only administrator.

conbody.note: The full Couchbase administrator can connect to Couchbase Server at all times.

dlentry.dd: The full (built-in) Couchbase administrator is configured during installation. This administrator can configure one read-only Couchbase administrator and access all Couchbase Server functions, including the ability to enable LDAP and configure additional LDAP administrators.
Passwords for full Couchbase administrators must follow security best practices. See for more details.

The read-only administrator is optional and can be set by the full Couchbase administrator at any time using the Couchbase Web Console. This administrator can view certain activities without having ability to edit.
Passwords for read-only administrators follow the same security best practices. See for more details.
To set up credentials for the read-only Couchbase administrator, open the Couchbase Web Console and go to Settings Account Management to enter the administrator's credentials.
